column6: Process to determine material topics
column13: Our Sustainability Framework helps guide and focus our approach to sustainability. Our Sustainability Priorities focus on the environmental, social and governance (ESG) topics that matter most to our stakeholders and business. Our sustainability targets hold us accountable for making consistent progress and keep us focused on success.

column6: List of material topics
column7: Safety, Climate and environment, Our people, Customers and Community

column6: Management of material topics
column13: During 2023, Atlas Arteria also undertook an operational review focused on championing expertise, efficiency and automation to optimise operations. As part of this workstream, Skyway's Executive Team was further developed, with Kara Lawrence joining as Chief Financial Officer and Chad Elliot joining as Chief Operating Officer. They bring over 45 years of experience in people leadership, corporate finance, road operations and maintenance.

column6: Management of material topics
column13: A new operating model, launched in November, focuses on delivering on a well-defined strategic plan and operational objectives. It includes the addition of a North American Group Executive, for whom the recruitment process is underway. This new way of working marks a crucial milestone in the business's maturation, delivery of strategy, and succession planning.

column6: Management of material topics
column13: During 2023, Atlas Arteria championed a series of initiatives as part of its Chicago Skyway transition plan, with the asset management program, key refinancing activities and operational review all substantially complete by the end of the year. These changes are focused on delivering capital efficiency and long-term sustainable value, including lifecycle cost savings and enhancements to capability and asset quality.
column20: Capital Efficiency, Sustainable Value, Transition Plan

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: Launching a new asset management program will allow Chicago Skyway's management to transition to a proactive, whole-of-life approach to maintenance. It will enable Skyway to better monitor and manage its assets by detecting the required maintenance early and selecting the right intervention cycle to improve safety. It will minimise risk and reduce the overall capex requirements of the business over its life cycle.\t

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: We conducted a climate-scenario analysis to help assess the strategic implications of climate change over the short, medium, and long term. For this climate analysis, we define each as short (2030), medium (2040), and long-term (2050).\t
column20: Climate-scenario Analysis, Risk Assessment, Strategic Implications

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: Corporate and asset-based subject matter experts were engaged in desktop analysis, research, one-on-one interviews, and workshops. Their expertise was utilised in identifying and prioritising relevant climate-related risks, supported by our risk management framework and scenario analysis. The process, which has been ongoing since 2022, has included climate modelling, providing insight into potential physical climate-related changes (e.g. temperature, precipitation, flooding) in each asset location.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column8: Qualitative and quantitative assessment of the potential business impacts
column13: This work provided the basis for a qualitative assessment of the potential business impacts of the risks and opportunities identified and how these impacts need to be considered in our strategic decision-making. In 2023, this led to a project to establish a quantitative assessment of the potential financial impacts of climate-related risks.

Infrastructure investments and services supported
column7: In February 2024, APRR and Eiffage were appointed to exclusive negotiations for the A412 Thonon-Machilly project in France. The A412 is a new 16.5km motorway from Thonon-les-Bains to Machilly, south of Lake Geneva. The project will consist of a two-lane dual carriageway with free-flow tolling that will reduce congestion and travel times.

column7: Weighted average traffic performance in 2023: 3.3% higher than in 2022 and 2.9% above 2019

column7: In December 2023, the French Government imposed a new tax on companies operating long-distance transport infrastructure. The tax will represent 4.6% of revenues exceeding Ã¢ÂÂ¬120 million per legal entity and is expected to apply to both APRR and AREA based on historical earnings. Atlas Arteria and our partners at APRR are committed to using all appropriate means and avenues to assert APRR's legal and contractual rights to ensure that the concession contracts are respected and their rights are protected.

Energy consumption within the organization
column7: Electric vehicle usage and charging stations have also increased for the APRR Group's internal fleet during the year. It takes the total number of charging stations for internal operations to 190 and the total number of electric light vehicles to 332, equating to 31% (2022: 23%) of APRR's light vehicle fleet. The aim is to electrify 75% of APRR's light vehicle fleet by 2025.

Interactions with water as a shared resource
column7: Water is a precious resource, so we are mindful of and careful with our water use at Atlas Arteria. Most of our water use is at APRR, and we aim for a 2% yearly reduction. The focus has been on accurate measuring to identify and rectify leaks.
